tit.cmt: すぐ下に説明があるためここはタイトルのみとしました。

sen.j: 寺社伝奏（じしゃでんそう）は、中世・近世の公家政権に設置された役職。
sen.e: A jisha denso was a post placed in the Kuge (court nobles) Government of the Kamakura and Muromachi period or modern times.
Jisha denso was a post placed in the Kuge (court nobles) Government in the medieval period and modern times.
sen.cmt: 冠詞削除、接続詞変更、前置詞変更、「medieval period」を選択
sen.e: Jisha denso was a post placed in the Kuge (court nobles) Government in the medieval period and modern times.

sen.j: 特定寺社からの奏請を上皇・天皇へ取り次ぐ伝奏。
sen.e: Denso was a person who relayed petitions from specific temples and shrines to the retired Emperor or the Emperor.
It was denso who relayed petitions from specific temples and shrines to the retired Emperor or the Emperor.
sen.cmt: 原文に沿うよう文章変更
sen.e: It was denso who relayed petitions from specific temples and shrines to the retired Emperor or the Emperor.

sen.j: 「伝奏」という語は平安時代後期以後に成立しているが、役職としての成立は鎌倉時代の後嵯峨天皇院政期である。
sen.e: The word 'denso' had been established after the late Heian period but the post was established during insei period (during the period of the government by the retired Emperor) of the Kamakura period.

The word 'denso' had been established after the late Heian period but the post was established during Emperor Gosaga's insei period (during the period of the government by the retired Emperor) in the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: 「後嵯峨天皇」訳抜け、前置詞変更
sen.e: The word 'denso' had been established after the late Heian period but the post was established during Emperor Gosaga's insei period (during the period of the government by the retired Emperor) in the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 伝奏は院や天皇に任じられ、関東申次管掌以外の全ての奏請を扱っていた。
sen.e: Denso were appointed by In (the retired Emperor) or the Emperor and dealt with all petitions except ones managed by Kanto moshitsugi (court-appointed liaison with the bakufu [Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun]).

Denso was appointed by In (the retired Emperor) or the Emperor and dealt with all petitions except ones managed by Kanto moshitsugi (court-appointed liaison with the bakufu [Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun]).

Denso was appointed by In (the retired Emperor) or the Emperor and dealt with all petitions except ones managed by Kanto moshitsugi (court-appointed liaison with the bakufu [Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun]).

sen.j: だが、寺社興行が盛んになった後伏見天皇院政期以後、伝奏の職掌の細分化が進み、国家的に重要な地位を占める特定の寺社との間の取り次ぎを扱う伝奏が設置されるようになる。
sen.e: However, after Ex-emperor Gofushimi's era, the official duties of the denso were broken into smaller and denso who relayed between the retired Emperor or the Emperor and specific temples and shrines which occupied a nationally important position were established.

However, after Ex-emperor Gofushimi's era, when many temples and shrines were restored, the official duties of the denso were broken into smaller and denso who relayed between the retired Emperor or the Emperor and specific temples and shrines which occupied nationally important positions was established.
sen.cmt: 「寺社興行が盛んになった」訳抜け、複数化、単数化
sen.e: However, after Ex-emperor Gofushimi's era, when many temples and shrines were restored, the official duties of the denso were broken into smaller and denso who relayed between the retired Emperor or the Emperor and specific temples and shrines which occupied nationally important positions was established.

sen.j: 伊勢神宮の「神宮伝奏」、賀茂社の「賀茂伝奏」、延暦寺の「山門伝奏」、興福寺など奈良の寺院を統括する「南都伝奏」などが設置された。
sen.e: Jingutenso' (shrine messenger to Emperor) of Ise Jingu Shrine, 'Kamo-denso' (Kamo shrine messenger to Emperor) of Kamo-sha Shrine, 'Sanmon-denso' (Enryaku-ji Temple messenger to Emperor) of Enryaku-ji Temple, 'Nanto-denso' which controlled temples such as Kofuku-ji Temple in Nara and others were established.

Jingutenso' (shrine messenger to the Emperor) of Ise Jingu Shrine, 'Kamo-denso' (Kamo shrine messenger to the Emperor) of Kamo-sha Shrine, 'Sanmon-denso' (Enryaku-ji Temple messenger tothe Emperor) of Enryaku-ji Temple, 'Nanto-denso' which controlled temples in Nara such as Kofuku-ji Temple, and others were established.
sen.cmt: 冠詞挿入、語順変更、コンマ挿入
sen.e: Jingutenso' (shrine messenger to the Emperor) of Ise Jingu Shrine, 'Kamo-denso' (Kamo shrine messenger to the Emperor) of Kamo-sha Shrine, 'Sanmon-denso' (Enryaku-ji Temple messenger tothe Emperor) of Enryaku-ji Temple, 'Nanto-denso' which controlled temples in Nara such as Kofuku-ji Temple, and others were established.

sen.j: 南北朝時代 (日本)に入ると、政務の実権が朝廷から幕府に移るようになると、依然として任免は院や天皇が行っていたものの、その職務は寺社からの奏請を受けて室町幕府及び征夷大将軍への取り次ぎを行う役に転じるようになる。
sen.e: During the period of the Northern and Southern Courts, as the real power of government affairs moved from the Imperial Court to the bakufu, the denso's duty changed and became to relay petitions from temples and shrines to the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun during the Muromachi period) and Seitaishogun (commander-in-chief of the expeditionary force against the barbarians, great, unifying leader) although the appointment and dismissal were still done by In and the Emperor.

During the period of the Northern and Southern Courts, as real power of the government affairs moved from the Imperial Court to bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), the denso's duty changed to relaying petitions from temples and shrines to the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun during the Muromachi period) and Seitaishogun (commander-in-chief of the expeditionary force against the barbarians, great, unifying leader) although appointment and dismissal were still done by In and the Emperor.
sen.cmt: 冠詞削除&挿入、幕府の説明挿入、文の簡略化
sen.e: During the period of the Northern and Southern Courts, as real power of the government affairs moved from the Imperial Court to bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), the denso's duty changed to relaying petitions from temples and shrines to the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun during the Muromachi period) and Seitaishogun (commander-in-chief of the expeditionary force against the barbarians, great, unifying leader) although appointment and dismissal were still done by In and the Emperor.

sen.j: これによって寺社伝奏は幕府役職としての要素を併せ持つことになる。
sen.e: As a result, jisha denso also became a kind of a post of the bakufu.
As a result, jisha denso also had a function in the bakufu.
As a result, jisha denso also had a function in the bakufu.

sen.j: これは一般民政を担当していた惣伝奏（そうでんそう）が関東申次に代わって設置された武家伝奏の職へと変化していくのと軌を一にしている。
sen.e: It was the same way that so denso which was in charge of civil administration shifted to the role of buke tenso established instead of Kanto moshitsugi.
It was the same way that so denso which was in charge of civil administration shifted to the role of buke tenso established instead of Kanto moshitsugi.
It was the same way that so denso which was in charge of civil administration shifted to the role of buke tenso established instead of Kanto moshitsugi.

sen.j: だが、応仁の乱後には室町幕府の政治力は衰微して寺社伝奏は再び院や天皇に取り次ぐ役に戻ることになる。
sen.e: However, after Onin war, the jisha denso became a messenger for In or the Emperor again since the political power of the Muromachi bakufu weakened.

sen.j: 江戸時代に入ると、武家伝奏の監督下のもとで寺社から奏請を武家伝奏を経由して院・天皇、場合によっては江戸幕府に取り次ぐ役職になる。
sen.e: In the Edo period, they relayed petitions from temples and shrines through buke tenso to In or the Emperor and in some cases, to the Edo bakufu under the supervision of the buke denso.
In the Edo period, they relayed petitions from temples and shrines through buke tenso to In or the Emperor and in some cases, to the Edo bakufu under the supervision of the buke denso.

sen.j: ただし、それまでの特定の重要な寺社に限定されず、中小の寺社や各宗派・教派からの奏請を受けるようになる。
sen.e: Moreover, they started to receive petitions not only from specific important temples and shrines but also from small temples and shrines from each sect.
Moreover, they started to receive petitions not only from specific important temples and shrines but also from small temples and shrines of each sect.
Moreover, they started to receive petitions not only from specific important temples and shrines but also from small temples and shrines of each sect.

sen.j: ただし、門跡が置かれた宗派（法相宗・天台宗・真言宗など）では門跡経由で奏請が行われ、中小の神社は吉田家もしくは白川家が取り次ぎを行った。
sen.e: However, in sects (such as Hosso sect, Tendai sect, Shingon sect and so on) which monzeki (successor of a temple) was placed, petitioning the Emperor was performed through monzeki, and in small temples and shrines, it was done by the Yoshida family or the Shirakawa family.

sen.j: 更に江戸幕府の保護の厚い宗派（新義真言宗豊山派・臨済宗五山派・浄土宗・浄土真宗本願寺派など）の寺社伝奏は武家伝奏の兼任として行われていた。
sen.e: In addition, jisha tenso was also buke denso in sects (Shingi Shingon sect Buzan-ha [ha means group], Rinzai sect Gozan-ha, Jodo sect, Jodo Shingon sect Hongan-ji Temple-ha and so on) protected carefully by the Edo bakufu.

In addition, jisha tenso held the post of buke denso concurrently in sects (Shingi Shingon sect Buzan-ha [ha means group], Rinzai sect Gozan-ha, Jodo sect, Jodo Shingon sect Hongan-ji Temple-ha and so on) which were protected carefully by the Edo bakufu.
